name: testing
title: Google Cloud Testing API
description: Allows developers to run automated tests for their mobile applications on Google infrastructure.

enumDescriptions: Responses with Content-Type of application/json
Media download with context-dependent Content-Type
Responses with Content-Type of application/x-protobuf

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

enumDescriptions: v1 error format
v2 error format

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl.description: View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services
View your data across Google Cloud Platform services

Device.description: A GCE virtual Android device instance.

id.description:
Unique id set by the backend.
NOT user-specified

projectId.description:
Project id set by the backend.
NOT user-specified

state.description:
State of the device.
NOT user-specified
enumDescriptions: Do not use.  For proto versioning only.
The device is in the process of spinning up.
The device is created and ready to use.
The device has been closed.
There has been an error.

stateDetails.description:
Details about the state of the device.
NOT user-specified

deviceDetails.description:
Information about the backing GCE instance and connection.
NOT user-specified

creationTime.description:
The time the request to create this device was received.
NOT user-specified

androidDevice.description:
The Android device configuration.
User-specified
Required

DeviceStateDetails.description: Additional details about the status of the device.

progressDetails.description:
A human-readable, detailed description of the device's status.
For example: "Starting Device\n Device Ready".

During the device's lifespan data may be appended to the progress.

errorDetails.description:
If the DeviceState is ERROR, then this string may contain human-readable
details about the error.

DeviceDetails.description: Details about the GCE instance and connection.

gceInstanceDetails.description: Details about the GCE instance backing the device.

connectionInfo.description: Details about the connection to the device.

GceInstanceDetails.description:
This information is provided for the user to look up additional details of
the backing GCE instance. It is assumed the user does not modify this
instance. If so, then the device service makes no guarantees about
device functionality.

projectId.description:
The GCE project that contains the instance backing this device. If
user-specified, must be the same as the project_id in the
CreateDeviceRequest.

zone.description:
Desired GCE zone for the device
user-specified

name.description:
Desired instance name of the device.
May be user-specified. If not, the backend will choose a name.

ConnectionInfo.description:
Information needed to connect to services running on the virtual device. The
ssh_port is used to connect to the device, and then the adb_port and vnc_port
on the device can be forwarded to two local ports, to which adb and vnc can
connect, respectively.

All of the fields in this message are provided by the backend.

ipAddress.description:
IP address of the device.
NOT user-specified
Required

adbPort.description:
Port for ADB (e.g. 5555)
NOT user-specified
Required

sshPort.description:
Port for SSH (e.g. 22)
NOT user-specified
Required

vncPort.description:
Port for VNC (e.g. 6444)
NOT user-specified
Required

vncPassword.description:
Password for VNC
NOT user-specified
Required

androidModelId.description:
The id of the Android device to be used.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

androidVersionId.description:
The id of the Android OS version to be used.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

locale.description:
The locale the test device used for testing.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

orientation.description:
How the device is oriented during the test.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

ListDevicesResponse.description: Response containing a list of devices. Supports pagination.

devices.description: The GCE virtual Android devices to be returned.

nextPageToken.description: The pagination token to retrieve the next page of device results.

ListTestMatricesResponse.description: Response contain a list of Test Matrices.

TestMatrix.description:
A group of one or more TestExecutions, built by taking a
product of values over a pre-defined set of axes.

testMatrixId.description:
Unique id set by the service.
@OutputOnly

projectId.description:
The cloud project that owns the test matrix.
@OutputOnly

clientInfo.description: Information about the client which invoked the test.

testSpecification.description:
How to run the test.
Required

environmentMatrix.description:
How the host machine(s) are configured.
Required

testExecutions.description:
The list of test executions that the service creates for this matrix.
@OutputOnly

resultStorage.description:
Where the results for the matrix are written.
Required

state.description:
Indicates the current progress of the test matrix (e.g., FINISHED)
@OutputOnly
enumDescriptions: Do not use.  For proto versioning only.
The execution or matrix is being validated.
The execution or matrix is waiting for resources to become available.

The execution is currently being processed.

Can only be set on an execution.

The execution or matrix has terminated normally.

On a matrix this means that the matrix level processing completed normally,
but individual executions may be in an ERROR state.

The execution or matrix has stopped because it encountered an
infrastructure failure.

The execution was not run because it corresponds to a unsupported
environment.

Can only be set on an execution.

The execution was not run because the provided inputs are incompatible with
the requested environment.

Example: requested AndroidVersion is lower than APK's minSdkVersion

Can only be set on an execution.

The execution was not run because the provided inputs are incompatible with
the requested architecture.

Example: requested device does not support running the native code in
the supplied APK

Can only be set on an execution.

The user cancelled the execution.

Can only be set on an execution.

The execution or matrix was not run because the provided inputs are not
valid.

Examples: input file is not of the expected type, is malformed/corrupt, or
was flagged as malware

timestamp.description:
The time this test matrix was initially created.
@OutputOnly

ClientInfo.description: Information about the client which invoked the test.

TestSpecification.description: A description of how to run the test.

testTimeout.description:
Max time a test execution is allowed to run before it is
automatically cancelled.

testSetup.description: Test setup requirements e.g. files to install, bootstrap scripts

autoGoogleLogin.description:
Enables automatic Google account login.
If set, the service will automatically generate a Google test account
and use it to log into the device, before executing the test. Note that
test accounts might be reused.
Many applications can be tested more effectively in the context of
such an account.
Default is false.
Optional

TestSetup.description: A description of how to set up the device prior to running the test

obbFileName.description:
OBB file name which must conform to the format as specified by
Android
e.g. [main|patch].0300110.com.example.android.obb
which will be installed into
  <shared-storage>/Android/obb/<package-name>/
on the device

obb.description: Opaque Binary Blob (OBB) file(s) to install on the device

FileReference.description: A reference to a file, used for user inputs.

gcsPath.description:
A path to a file in Google Cloud Storage.
Example: gs://build-app-1414623860166/app-debug-unaligned.apk

BlobstoreFile.description: Reference to a blob in Blobstore.

md5Hash.description:
The MD5 hash of the referenced blob. (This is necessary to create a
Bigstore object directly from the Blobstore reference.)

AndroidInstrumentationTest.description:
A test of an Android application that can control an Android component
independently of its normal lifecycle.
Android instrumentation tests run an application APK and test APK inside the
same process on a virtual or physical AndroidDevice.  They also specify
a test runner class, such as com.google.GoogleTestRunner, which can vary
on the specific instrumentation framework chosen.

See <http://developer.android.com/tools/testing/testing_android.html> for
more information on types of Android tests.

appApk.description:
The APK for the application under test.
Required

testApk.description:
The APK containing the test code to be executed.
Required

appPackageId.description:
The java package for the application under test.
Optional, default is determined by examining the application's manifest.

testPackageId.description:
The java package for the test to be executed.
Optional, default is determined by examining the application's manifest.

testRunnerClass.description:
The InstrumentationTestRunner class.
Optional, default is determined by examining the application's manifest.

testTargets.description:
Each target must be fully qualified with the package name or class name,
in one of these formats:
 - "package package_name"
 - "class package_name.class_name"
 - "class package_name.class_name#method_name"

If empty, all targets in the module will be run.

AndroidRoboTest.description:
A test of an android application that explores the application on a virtual
or physical Android Device, finding culprits and crashes as it goes.

appApk.description:
The APK for the application under test.
Required

appPackageId.description:
The java package for the application under test.
Optional, default is determined by examining the application's manifest.

appInitialActivity.description:
The initial activity that should be used to start the app.
Optional

bootstrapApk.description:
The APK used for bootstrapping (e.g., passing the login screen).
Optional

bootstrapPackageId.description:
The java package for the bootstrap.
Optional

bootstrapRunnerClass.description:
The runner class for the bootstrap.
Optional

maxDepth.description:
The max depth of the traversal stack Robo can explore. Needs to be at least
2 to make Robo explore the app beyond the first activity.
Default is 50.
Optional

maxSteps.description:
The max number of steps Robo can execute.
Default is no limit.
Optional

randomizeSteps.description:
Whether Robo follows a random order of steps on a given activity state.
Optional

AndroidMonkeyTest.description:
A test of an Android application that uses the UI/Application Exerciser
Monkey from the Android SDK. (Not to be confused with the "monkeyrunner"
tool, which is also included in the SDK.)

See http://developer.android.com/tools/help/monkey.html for details.

appApk.description:
The APK for the application under test.
Required

appPackageId.description:
The java package for the application under test.
Optional, default is determined by examining the application's manifest.

eventCount.description:
Number of random monkey events (e.g. clicks, touches) to generate.
Defaults to 2000.

eventDelay.description:
Fixed delay between events.
Defaults to 10ms.

randomSeed.description:
Seed value for pseudo-random number generator.
Note that, although specifying a seed causes the monkey to generate the
same sequence of events, it does not guarantee that a particular outcome
will be reproducible across runs.
Optional

EnvironmentMatrix.description: The matrix of environments in which the test is to be executed.

AndroidMatrix.description:
A set of Android device configuration permutations is defined by the
the cross-product of the given axes.  Internally, the given AndroidMatrix
will be expanded into a set of AndroidDevices.

Only supported permutations will be instantiated.  Invalid permutations
(e.g., incompatible models/versions) are ignored.

androidModelIds.description:
The ids of the set of Android device to be used.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

androidVersionIds.description:
The ids of the set of Android OS version to be used.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

locales.description:
The set of locales the test device will enable for testing.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

orientations.description:
The set of orientations to test with.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.
Required

TestExecution.description: Specifies a single test to be executed in a single environment.

id.description:
Unique id set by the backend.
@OutputOnly

projectId.description:
The cloud project that owns the test execution.
@OutputOnly

environment.description:
How the host machine(s) are configured.
@OutputOnly

state.description:
Indicates the current progress of the test execution (e.g., FINISHED).
@OutputOnly
enumDescriptions: Do not use.  For proto versioning only.
The execution or matrix is being validated.
The execution or matrix is waiting for resources to become available.

The execution is currently being processed.

Can only be set on an execution.

The execution or matrix has terminated normally.

On a matrix this means that the matrix level processing completed normally,
but individual executions may be in an ERROR state.

The execution or matrix has stopped because it encountered an
infrastructure failure.

The execution was not run because it corresponds to a unsupported
environment.

Can only be set on an execution.

The execution was not run because the provided inputs are incompatible with
the requested environment.

Example: requested AndroidVersion is lower than APK's minSdkVersion

Can only be set on an execution.

The execution was not run because the provided inputs are incompatible with

Example: requested device does not support running the native code in

Can only be set on an execution.

The user cancelled the execution.

Can only be set on an execution.

Examples: input file is not of the expected type, is malformed/corrupt, or

toolResultsStep.description:
Where the results for this execution are written.
@OutputOnly

timestamp.description:
The time this test execution was initially created.
@OutputOnly

testDetails.description:
Additional details about the running test.
@OutputOnly

Environment.description: The environment in which the test is run.

androidDevice.description: An Android device which must be used with an Android test.

ToolResultsStep.description:
Represents a tool results step resource.

This has the results of a TestExecution.

projectId.description:
The cloud project that owns the tool results step.
@OutputOnly

TestDetails.description: Additional details about the progress of the running test.

progressMessages.description:
Human-readable, detailed descriptions of the test's progress.
For example: "Provisioning a device", "Starting Test".

During the course of execution new data may be appended
to the end of progress_messages.
@OutputOnly

ResultStorage.description: Locations where the results of running the test are stored.

toolResultsHistory.description:
The tool results history that contains the tool results execution that
results are written to.

If not provided the service will choose an appropriate value.

toolResultsExecution.description:
The tool results execution that results are written to.
@OutputOnly

GoogleCloudStorage.description: A storage location within Google cloud storage (GCS).

gcsPath.description:
The path to a directory in GCS that will
eventually contain the results for this test.
The requesting user must have write access on the bucket in the supplied
path.

ToolResultsHistory.description: Represents a tool results history resource.

projectId.description: The cloud project that owns the tool results history.

ToolResultsExecution.description:
Represents a tool results execution resource.

This has the results of a TestMatrix.

projectId.description:
The cloud project that owns the tool results execution.
@OutputOnly

CancelTestMatrixResponse.description: Response containing the state of a cancelled test matrix.

testState.description: The rolled-up state of the test matrix just before it was cancelled.

id.description:
Unique id set by the system.
@OutputOnly

projectId.description:
The GCE project for this WebDriver test environment.
@OutputOnly

browserId.description:
The id of the browser to be used.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported values.
Required

vmDetails.description:
The state details of the target device/machine.
@OutputOnly

sshPublicKey.description: The public key to be set on the VM in order to SSH into it.

enumDescriptions: Do not use.  For proto versioning only.
The device is in the process of spinning up.
The device is created and ready to use.
The device has been closed.
There has been an error.

stateDetails.description:
Details about the state of the device.
@OutputOnly

deviceDetails.description:
Information about the backing GCE instance and connection.
@OutputOnly

creationTime.description:
The time this device was initially created.
@OutputOnly

versionId.description:
The version id of the Linux OS to be used.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.

The version id of the Windows OS to be used.
Use the EnvironmentDiscoveryService to get supported options.

ListWebDriverResponse.description: Response containing a list of WebDriver environments. Supports pagination.

webdriverEnvironments.description: The WebDriver environments to be returned.

nextPageToken.description: The pagination token to retrieve the next page of WebDriver results.

WebDriverKeepAliveRequest.description:
Request to issue a keep-alive to a WebDriver environment instance by
project and webdriver ids.

TestEnvironmentCatalog.description: A description of a test environment.

androidDeviceCatalog.description: Android devices suitable for running Android Instrumentation Tests.

webDriverCatalog.description: WebDriver environments suitable for running web tests.

models.description:
The set of supported Android device models.
@OutputOnly

versions.description:
The set of supported Android OS versions.
@OutputOnly

runtimeConfiguration.description:
The set of supported runtime configurations.
@OutputOnly

AndroidModel.description: A description of an Android device tests may be run on.

form.description:
Whether this device is virtual or physical.
@OutputOnly
enumDescriptions: Do not use.  For proto versioning only.
A software stack that simulates the device
Actual hardware

screenX.description:
Screen size in the horizontal (X) dimension measured in pixels.
@OutputOnly

screenY.description:
Screen size in the vertical (Y) dimension measured in pixels.
@OutputOnly

supportedAbis.description:
The list of supported ABIs for this device.
This corresponds to either android.os.Build.SUPPORTED_ABIS (for API level
21 and above) or android.os.Build.CPU_ABI/CPU_ABI2.
@OutputOnly

AndroidVersion.description: A version of the Android OS

releaseDate.description:
The date this Android version became available in the market.
@OutputOnly

Date.description:
Represents a whole calendar date, e.g. date of birth. The time of day and
time zone are either specified elsewhere or are not significant. The date
is relative to the Proleptic Gregorian Calendar. The day may be 0 to
represent a year and month where the day is not significant, e.g. credit card
expiration date. The year may be 0 to represent a month and day independent
of year, e.g. anniversary date. Related types are google.type.TimeOfDay
and `google.protobuf.Timestamp`.

year.description:
Year of date. Must be from 1 to 9999, or 0 if specifying a date without
a year.

month.description: Month of year. Must be from 1 to 12.

day.description:
Day of month. Must be from 1 to 31 and valid for the year and month, or 0
if specifying a year/month where the day is not significant.

Distribution.description:
Data about the relative number of devices running a
given configuration of the Android platform.

measurementTime.description:
The time this distribution was measured.
@OutputOnly

marketShare.description:
The estimated fraction (0-1) of the total market with this configuration.
@OutputOnly

AndroidRuntimeConfiguration.description: Configuration that can be selected at the time a test is run.

region.description:
A human-friendy string representing the region for this locale.
Example: "United States"
Not present for every locale.
@OutputOnly

WebDriverCatalog.description: The currently supported WebDriver VM resources.

id.description:
A human readable id for this Browser version.
Use this id to invoke the TestExecutionService.
Examples: "chrome-stable-channel", "firefox-beta-channel"
@OutputOnly

androidCatalog.description:
The catalog of Android devices for which we offer this browser.
@OutputOnly

linuxCatalog.description:
The catalog of Linux machines which we offer this browser.
@OutputOnly

windowsCatalog.description:
The catalog of Windows machines which we offer this browser.
@OutputOnly

versions.description:
The set of supported Linux versions.
@OutputOnly

LinuxVersion.description: A verison of a Linux OS.

id.description:
The unique opaque id for this Linux Version.
@OutputOnly

versions.description:
The set of supported Windows versions.
@OutputOnly

WindowsVersion.description: A version of a Windows OS.

id.description:
The unique opaque id for this Windows Version.
@OutputOnly

create.description:
Creates a new GCE Android device.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to write to project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the device type or project does not exist

projectId.description: The GCE project under which to create the device.

sshPublicKey.description: The public key to be set on the device in order to SSH into it.

get.description:
Returns the GCE Android device.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the device type or project does not exist

projectId.description: The GCE project that contains this device instance.

deviceId.description: The id of the GCE Android virtual device.

list.description:
Lists all the current devices.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the project does not exist

projectId.description: The GCE project to list the devices from.

pageSize.description: Used to specify the max number of device results to be returned.

pageToken.description: Used to request a specific page of the device results list.

delete.description:
Deletes a GCE Android device instance.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the project does not exist

projectId.description: The GCE project that contains the device to be deleted.

deviceId.description: The GCE virtual Android device to be deleted.

keepalive.description:
Issues a keep-alive to a GCE Android device instance.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the project does not exist

projectId.description: The GCE project that contains the device to be issued the keep-alive.

deviceId.description: The GCE virtual Android device to be issued the keep-alive.

list.description:
List test matrices.
The matrices are returned in the order of newest first by submit time.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed

projectId.description: Cloud project that owns the tests.

create.description:
Request to run a matrix of tests according to the given specifications.
Unsupported environments will be returned in the state UNSUPPORTED.
Matrices are limited to at most 200 supported executions.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to write to project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed or if the matrix expands
                     to more than 200 supported executions

projectId.description: The GCE project under which this job will run.

get.description:
Check the status of a test matrix.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the Test Matrix does not exist

projectId.description: Cloud project that owns the test matrix.

testMatrixId.description: Unique test matrix id which was assigned by the service.

delete.description:
Delete all record of a test matrix plus any associated test executions.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the Test Matrix does not exist

projectId.description: Cloud project that owns the test.

testMatrixId.description: Test matrix that will be canceled.

cancel.description:
Cancels unfinished test executions in a test matrix.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the Test Matrix does not exist

projectId.description: Cloud project that owns the test.

testMatrixId.description: Test matrix that will be canceled.

create.description:
Creates a new WebDriver environment and returns the endpoint for the user
to access.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to write to project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the WebDriver environment or project does not exist

projectId.description: The GCP project under which to create the WebDriver environment.

get.description:
Returns the WebDriver environment.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the WebDriver environment or project does not exist

projectId.description: The GCP project that contains this WebDriver instance.

webdriverId.description:
The GCE WebDriver environment to be deleted specified from the
WebDriver id.

list.description:
Lists all the WebDriver environments.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the project does not exist

projectId.description: The GCP project to list the environments from.

pageSize.description: Used to specify the max number of results to be returned.

pageToken.description: Used to request a specific page of the results list.

delete.description:
Deletes a WebDriver environment instance.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the project does not exist

projectId.description: The GCP project that contains the WebDriver endpoint to be deleted.

webdriverId.description:
The GCE WebDriver environment to be deleted specified from the
WebDriver id.

keepalive.description:
Issues a keep-alive to the WebDriver environment instance.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to read project
- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the project does not exist

projectId.description: The GCP project that contains the webdriver to be issued the keep-alive.

webdriverId.description: The WebDriver environment to be issued the keep-alive.

get.description:
Get the catalog of supported test environments.

May return any of the following canonical error codes:

- INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed
- NOT_FOUND - if the environment type does not exist
- INTERNAL - if an internal error occurred

environmentType.description: The type of environment that should be listed.
